WorkItem.Description:
Rawr want's my Combat rogue to use dagger/sword instead of sword/sword. To be specific it picks Unsharped Ice razor (MH) & Nighttime(OH) as being better then Nightime(MH) & Liar's Tongue(OH) Version .18 does not make this same mistake. It seems like the rotation picked generates much more damage then it should be (some back-stab and SnD rotation).
 
Edit Jun 25, 2010:
 
It seems like Rawr is not estimating enough damage for eviscerate, therefore it is choosing a weaker rotation (one with out eviscerate). Read comment, view .doc attachment for more info.
WorkItem.Summary: [Rogue] Optimizer wants Dagger/Sword instead of Sword/Sword

Comments.Message: Here is the same char in v.18

After a fast check I don't see a bug, but the rotation chosen is indeed not standard.
Which attacks generate too much damage in the v19 char? If you mouseover a certain attack you get more info on it.
A WoW Rogue is not makeup.

I think I've kind of figured out what is happening. Seems like v.19 doesn't calculate the damage for eviscerate correctly. Attach is the copy to clipboard readout for both 18 and 19.It doesn't give the damage though, but each ability is similar except for eviscerate. 

Eviscerate v18 --- v19
Damage per Landed Swing 4626.487 -- 360.505
Damage per Hit 2921.554 -- 227.65
Damage per Energy 132.1848 -- 10.30

So that strike me as very odd.

Misc info:

Settings: 
use Multithreading
enforce profession requirements

Proc effect calculation mode: Advanced High Precision
Effect combination Calculation mode: High Precision
Enable warning in Optimizer
Simulated Annealing
All Combinations

The difference in the Evis tooltip is due to it not being used.
As the tooltip damage numbers are calculated using the actually used number of CPs and this is 0 when Evis is not used it then shows very low numbers.
